results.definition: a support or foundation
examples: the base of the lamp

results.definition: the position where a thing or person stands
a growth of similar plants (usually trees) in a particular area
examples: they cut down a stand of trees

results.definition: a small table for holding articles of various kinds
examples: a bedside stand

results.definition: a support for displaying various articles
examples: the newspapers were arranged on a rack

results.definition: an interruption of normal activity
a mental position from which things are viewed
examples: we should consider this problem from the viewpoint of the Russians
teaching history gave him a special point of view toward current events

results.definition: a booth where articles are displayed for sale
a stop made by a touring musical or theatrical group to give a performance
examples: a one-night stand

results.definition: tiered seats consisting of a structure (often made of wood) where people can sit to watch an event (game or parade)
a platform where a (brass) band can play in the open air
a defensive effort
examples: the army made a final stand at the Rhone

results.definition: be standing; be upright
examples: We had to stand for the entire performance!

results.definition: be in some specified state or condition
examples: I stand corrected

results.definition: occupy a place or location, also metaphorically
examples: We stand on common ground

results.definition: hold one's ground; maintain a position; be steadfast or upright
examples: I am standing my ground and won't give in!

results.definition: put up with something or somebody unpleasant
examples: I cannot bear his constant criticism
The new secretary had to endure a lot of unprofessional remarks
he learned to tolerate the heat
She stuck out two years in a miserable marriage

results.definition: have or maintain a position or stand on an issue
examples: Where do you stand on the War?

results.definition: remain inactive or immobile
examples: standing water

results.definition: be in effect; be or remain in force
examples: The law stands!

results.definition: be tall; have a height of; copula
examples: She stands 6 feet tall

results.definition: put into an upright position
examples: Can you stand the bookshelf up?

results.definition: withstand the force of something
examples: The trees resisted her
stand the test of time
The mountain climbers had to fend against the ice and snow

results.definition: be available for stud services
examples: male domestic animals such as stallions serve selected females
